ygData.subject: Re: New poll for nbwrpg
ygData.msgSnippet: *sigh* Were you just waiting for me to do something you didn t like to cut me down? Sure looks like it. You also seem to like to say that ego dominates all,

*sigh*

Were you just waiting for me to do something you didn't like to cut 
me down? Sure looks like it. You also seem to like to say that ego 
dominates all, which I will deny, and will deny time and time again. 
You don't know me well enough to judge me. Comparing me to Zardus is 
uncalled for, and wrong. We are two completely different people, who 
have different personalities, and think differently. For me to try 
to be someone I'm not is impossible. I can't help it if you feel i'm 
not Zardus, cause I'm not.

Fault should not be so frivolously tossed around. Yes, I did make 
Azure a moderator, after a 100% moderator vote. He has, as Rudrak 
has said, been a moderator for a few months now. When you say that 
not everyone voted for him to be a moderator, you are entirely 
correct. But by my judgement, and by anyone who understands how a 
vote works, 7-10 people isn't enough for a vote to be taken 
seriously at all. 

Hugar had been inactive for two months. Moderators shouldn't 
disappear for two months. I know that he's around cause I have him 
as a contact on an IM prog.

Kyle does tend to abuse the polls more than others, and that change 
of rules does affect him more than others, but any member of the rpg 
who wants a poll, ANY poll, can still email it too me, and i'll put 
it up quickly. Trillian (my chat prog) tells me when I have mail, 
thus allowing me to hop on my comp and create a poll at any time.

Tyrannical? Your pointing finger sticks out too far. I will never be 
a US president, and nor would I ever want to. 

<<Oh, you can moderate me if you want, but if you do, I'll leave, 
and I won't ever come back.>>

You say that line so much it has become irritating. It's like 
saying "I won't be your friend if you don't give me that candy". 
Like laying down a guilt line in hopes of getting some attention. I 
don't want you to leave -- I don't want anyone to leave -- but if 
you choose to go, I can't and won't stop you. Just don't run away 
from situations which you don't like.

How do I like you now? Are you asking me to hate you so you can 
justify your words? No, I won't do that. I don't hate anyone, and 
there is nothing you can say or do that would make me hate you, or 
anyone else for that matter. Perhaps that is a little boastful, but 
I've been living my life like that for many years now.

Ack, this will probably further the arguement... oh well, some stuff 
needs to be said.


--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Hollywood Narrator" <thecode@p...> wrote:
> OOC: I know I haven't posted in a while, due to a lack of ideas 
for the RPG, but I couldn't sit back anymore, I have to comment on 
this because it's just the way I am. Warrior Azure, I do not think 
you're a bad guy. In fact, this isn't even your fault, it's rAuq's 
fault. I am not saying Warrior Azure does not deserve to be a 
moderator, but he wasn't voted in by the RPG. Let's face it, rAuq, 
you stepped in suddenly, and without even asking the RPG if they 
thought this stuff was appropriate, you fling a bunch of new shit 
all over everyone. Some stupid new poll rule because of Dewboy, 
first of all, which wasn't fair. Unitron (Sorry, can't remember the 
other name, it being new and all, and I love Unicron rip offs!) is 
absolutely correct about this when he said that we're all being 
punished for something dipshit (Dewboy) did. Second, Hugar is thrown 
off the council by someone who was voted in for EQUAL POWER. You 
threw off someone of EQUAL POWER, rAuq, and without the people 
voting for it. The people of the RPG are allowed to make this choice 
for a reason. Zardus thought it would make the RPG a better 
community, and it has. It is stupid to try to revoke the people's 
privileges. We might as well have a tyrannical ruler instead of a US 
President! Then without the people voting him in, we have Warrior 
Azure as a moderator. I am in no way saying he won't make a good 
moderator, but that still is not the point. He wasn't voted into 
office. He just is suddenly assigned to the position because "rAuq 
says so" WHATSUPWITHAT!?!? This seems to be a matter of someone's 
head getting a little too big, maybe. Oh, you can moderate me if you 
want, but if you do, I'll leave, and I won't ever come back. What's 
important is that I stood up for what is right. Hugar shouldn't have 
been kicked off, moderators should be voted into office, and this 
dumbass poll rule should not have come into effect. And that is the 
bottom line. How do you like me now?...
